author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
review: A timeless classic that captures the essence of the Jazz Age and explores themes of love, wealth, and the American Dream.

author: George Orwell
review: A dystopian masterpiece that serves as a chilling warning about the dangers of totalitarianism and surveillance.

author: Harper Lee
review: A poignant story that confronts issues of racial injustice and moral growth in the American South.

author: J.D. Salinger
review: An iconic novel that explores teenage angst and rebellion with honesty and wit.

bookName: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
author: J.K. Rowling
review: A magical journey into the world of wizards and witches that captivates readers of all ages.

author: J.R.R. Tolkien
review: An enchanting tale of adventure and heroism set in Tolkien's richly imagined Middle-earth.

author: Jane Austen
review: A sparkling comedy of manners that explores themes of love, marriage, and social status.

author: J.R.R. Tolkien
review: An epic tale of friendship, courage, and the struggle against the forces of darkness.

author: Aldous Huxley
review: A provocative vision of a future society where individuality is sacrificed for stability.
